intro: Lippia americana f. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy lippia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its aromatic foliage and showy blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
